note: Vetted reference values and uncertainties for the global_consistency_test module (with explicit sources/definitions). Optional fields: enabled, sigma_theory (Gaussian theory error, combined in quadrature), sigma_floor (engineering floor to prevent single-observable dominance; strict z-scores are still reported). No covariance matrix is provided (treat as a dashboard, not a publication-grade global likelihood).

alpha_inv_0.definition: inverse fine-structure constant α^{-1}(0) in the Thomson limit (diagnostic; not the primary TFPT α truth test under the MSbar-at-MZ policy)
alpha_inv_0.source: NIST CODATA 2022: inverse fine-structure constant α^{-1}=137.035999177(21) (`https://physics.nist.gov/cgi-bin/cuu/Value?alphinv`)

alpha_bar5_inv_MZ.definition: inverse electromagnetic coupling ᾱ^{(5)}(MZ)^{-1} (primary TFPT α truth test; MSbar at MZ; compared via explicit α(0)→MZ running map)
alpha_bar5_inv_MZ.source: PDG 2024 electroweak review: α̂^{(5)}(MZ)^{-1} = 127.930 ± 0.008 (MSbar; see tfpt_suite/data/alpha_running_pdg.json).

beta_deg.definition: CMB cosmic birefringence global rotation angle β (deg), z≈1100
beta_deg.source: Minami & Komatsu (2020), Phys. Rev. Lett. 125, 221301: β = 0.35° ± 0.14° (Planck 2018 polarization, accounting for calibration) (`https://doi.org/10.1103/PhysRevLett.125.221301`)

n_s.definition: scalar spectral index n_s at pivot k0=0.05 Mpc^{-1} (Planck base-ΛCDM)
n_s.source: Planck 2018 results VI (2020), base-ΛCDM TT,TE,EE+lowE+lensing: n_s = 0.9649 ± 0.0042 (`https://arxiv.org/abs/1807.06209`)

A_s.definition: scalar amplitude A_s at pivot k0=0.05 Mpc^{-1} derived from ln(10^{10} A_s) (Planck base-ΛCDM)
A_s.source: Planck 2018 results VI (2020), base-ΛCDM TT,TE,EE+lowE+lensing: ln(10^{10} A_s)=3.044 ± 0.014 ⇒ A_s=exp(3.044)/1e10 (`https://arxiv.org/abs/1807.06209`)

r_upper_95.definition: tensor-to-scalar ratio r at pivot k0=0.05 Mpc^{-1} (95% CL upper bound)
